properties.name: Bedgegood's Farm
properties.description: Posted by DrtedI nearly killed a guy in a snowmobile accident. Ooops. Jay is okay though. He\'s an electrician now.

properties.name: Bonnet's Mill, Missouri
properties.description: Posted by DrtedBonett\'s Mill, MissouriI atteneded a wedding here in May \'05. It was quite a trip there and back. Probably one of the best adventures I\'ve ever been on - even if I did spend most of the time in my car.

properties.name: Bootlegers
properties.description: Posted by Drted3444 32nd Avenue NE, Calgary AlbertaI went out for a walk, looking for a local Calgary bar/pub. I found this. It was pretty good and holy fuck cheap! I had 10 wings for . A pitcher of beer for 0. My whole night cost me 1 + tip. You can\'t really complain about that. Plus, they had 40 different sauces to douse the wings in. I had sweet thai chili. It was pretty good.

properties.name: Bruderheim, Alberta
properties.description: Posted by DrtedBruderheim, AlbertaI stayed here for a few days in July 1993. I can\'t remember the address, but I was here.

properties.name: Bud Miller All Seasons Park
properties.description: Posted by Drted Bud Miller All Seasons ParkSome park we stopped at on our trip back from Edmonton in the summer of \'93 while the van we were in was getting a new radiator.

properties.name: Clare's Barbershop
properties.description: Posted by DrtedClare\'sThis is one of (if not the) barbers you can ever come across. Reasonable prices, free coffee and cookies, good magazine selection and I always run into a local mover and/or shaker.

properties.name: Duffin's Farm
properties.description: Posted by DrtedMy first job off the family farm. I picked up eggs for /hour. Tens of thousands of eggs every bloody day.

properties.name: Edmonton Sun
properties.description: Posted by DrtedI\'m working here as the middle leg of my Western Canada Work Tour of \'06. The IT guys here are great fun. You know it\'s a good place when they can\'t stop giggling even when things are blowing up all around them.

properties.name: Four Points Sheraton, Edmonton South
properties.description: Posted by DrtedIt\'s okay. Unless I\'ve missed it, there\'s no breakfast in the morning - and I was down for 8am. The pillows are too freaking soft, my first night here I wrenched my neck something fierce. It\'s been a couple days and I still hurt. There\'s a "Scottish Pub" attached to it that doesn\'t have any Scottish beer on tap. Oh well, the company is picking up the whole bill, so who am I to complain about the little things? (but would I spend my money here? um, no)

properties.name: Growlers Pub - Sunset
properties.description: Posted by Drted 3811 South Lindbergh Boulevard, Saint Louis, MO, 63127Growlers Pub - Sunset 314-984-9009 Oh man, I love this bar. It\'s too bad It\'s in St. Louis and I\'m in Toronto. A must visit for the beer lover.

properties.name: Healey's
properties.description: Posted by Drted178 Bathurst St, TorontoJeff Healeys nightclub. I\'ve been a couple times to see this crazy Led Zeppelin cover band. They play really well, but to look at them is another funny story altogether. The beer there has been obscenely expensive - perhaps it was just because of the cover band, but .25 for a bottle of beer is too fucking much. Assholes.

properties.name: Joe Mercury's
properties.description: Posted by Drted2345 B Dundas St. W TorontoJoe Mercury\'s is a neat place. Decent food, good beer at good prices and NTN trivia. Also, I don\'t feel like I\'m about to get stabbed there.

properties.name: Leesboro Central School
properties.description: Posted by Drted Where I went to elementary school.

properties.name: Linn Motel
properties.description: Posted by Drted 1221 East Main Street, Linn, MO, 65051Linn Motel 573-897-2999 I stayed here for a night in May \'05 with my friend Adam. The guy who runs is crazy. I\'d avoid it. If you do go, be sure to bring your own white bedsheets to replace all his, that have "LINN MOTEL" scrawled on them in black magic marker.

properties.name: Mount Pleasant Winery, Augusta MO
properties.description: Posted by DrtedMount Pleasant Winery, Augusta MissouriI went here on a wine-y day in June (or July) \'05. I drove down to St. Louis in one day (12 hour drive), and the next day we went out here. It\'s was great wine, and I ran into a guy working at the winery who was from Niagara Falls, Ontario. Trippy.

properties.name: My First Slum
properties.description: Posted by Drted100 Central Ave, LondonWhen I moved out of my parents house (well, ran away from home, I guess - but I was 18 at the time), I moved to 100 Central. It was a grimey slum, but it was my grimey slum. I stayed there for about 8 months. After my place was broke into, I moved.

properties.name: My First Toronto Apartment
properties.description: Posted by DrtedLiving the high life at High Park

properties.name: My House
properties.description: Posted by DrtedMy townhouse. I don\'t live there anymore, it\'s rented out. I live in Toronto now.

properties.name: Noah's Ark
properties.description: Posted by Drted2777 Danforth Avenue, TorontoTara and I stopped in here on our way home from Healey\'s one night. It was okay. Kinda down homey and we didn\'t feel like we were about to get stabbed.

properties.name: Peter's bar
properties.description: Posted by DrtedI have no idea what this bar was called. It was this bar owned by a Mongolian couple - Peter and Kelly, who had one helluva place. We\'d sit and drink until, oh 4am or so. The cops had other things to do than bust up some bar boozing it up until well after closing time. The decorations were great. Birthday streamers, a wood plaque of Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer saying "You Better Watch Your Step, Buddy" above the stairs to the bathroom. Not to mention the excellent, cheap beer prices. This place was great.

properties.name: Private pond with a nice big cottage
properties.description: Posted by DrtedPrivate pond with cottageThis is the bridal suite for a wedding I went to in May \'05. They had a present opening party here. It was quite a place.

properties.name: Staybridge Suites Hotel, Calgary
properties.description: Posted by Drted I stayed here while working at the Calgary Sun in the fall of \'06. Five Stars! It had quite a spread for breakfast, a small variety store in the lobby and the best housekeeping staff I\'ve ever had in a hotel. Olga, especially. You see, I had this little stuffed platypus that I had won at a the fall fair back in London. I tossed it into my suitcase, not really sure why. Anyway, I get to Calgary and while I\'m unpacking, I notice the platypus and toss it onto my nightstand. I come back from work the next day, and the housekeeper (Olga) had nestled it into the sheets on the bed, so it could be comfortable. It was the most heartwarming thing I had seen in a long time.

properties.name: Super 8 in the Indianapolis area
properties.description: Posted by DrtedSuper 8 in IndianapolisI\'ve stayed here a couple times. Once in May \'05, once in June or July of the same year. Reasonable rates, but drive yourself. The cabs are horrible here (as in they never come)

properties.name: Super 8 motel outside Chicago
properties.description: Posted by Drted I stayed here during my "Great Internet Journey" of 2005. I met up with Laura, from there we went to Prairie Rock Brewing Company for beer and nachos. It was a great time.

properties.name: The Apartment above the Porn Store
properties.description: Posted by DrtedI lived here for a few months. It was a crazy time.

properties.name: The Calgary Sun
properties.description: Posted by Drted2615 12 St. N.E. Calgary, AlbertaI worked here for a week as part of a corporate project. Chris, Don and Brian were all good fun. The job went well, no major problems... a couple minor ones. We all got along well and I can\'t wait to go visit them again.

properties.name: The Crows Nest Pub
properties.description: Posted by DrtedCaribana Parade at Church St., Toronto, ONI\'ve been boozing here many, many times. It\'s a nice place. They serve 80/-, which is always a big bonus in my books.

properties.name: The Dark Horse
properties.description: Posted by DrtedA fairly decent pub in Bloor West Village. I am often found boozing there.

properties.name: The Farm where I grew up
properties.description: Posted by DrtedThis is the farm where I grew up. It\'s not in the family any more. :(

properties.name: The Luxor
properties.description: Posted by Drtedthe LuxorThe Luxor hotel in Las Vegas. I stayed there for a week in 1995 (or was is 1996) while I attended the NAB show. Holy fuck was that a fun time. I was there as an exhibitor, so I got to see it all be set up and whatnot. I brought home so much schwag. Shirts, hats, books, etc.

properties.name: The Matador
properties.description: Posted by Drted466 Dovercourt TorontoThis place reminded me of the strip club in a dusk till dawn movie.

properties.name: The Toad and Turtle
properties.description: Posted by DrtedChris and I (Chris being from the Calgary Sun) and Chris\'s girlfriend went here on my last night in Calgary during my Western Canada Work Tour of \'06. It was a nice pub, and had I known it was there before the last night I was there, I would have gone more often.

properties.name: The Waltzing Weasel
properties.description: Posted by DrtedOne of the best pubs in London, Ontario. They have Caledonian 80/-, so they\'re aces in my book.

properties.name: The Yellow Griffin pub
properties.description: Posted by Drted2202 Bloor St W TorontoThe Yellow Griffin is a pretty good place for boozing. I always feel like I\'m paying about a dollar more per pint than anywhere else, so I don\'t go too often.

properties.name: Wawa Goose
properties.description: Posted by Drtedwawa, OntarioI tried to goose the Goose in Wawa, Ontario. I need to scan in pictures of this. It was too high up for me to do it successfully though :(

properties.name: West Edmonton Mall
properties.description: Posted by Drted West Edmonton MallWest Edmonton Mall. I was there in 1993. I think it\'s bigger now.

properties.name: Work (at the moment)
properties.description: Posted by Drted333 King St E, Toronto OntarioI work for Sun Media Corporation. It pays the bills...

properties.name: beerbistro
properties.description: Posted by Drted18 King St E. TorontoI\'ve only been to beerbistro once, and I was kinda tipsy when I got there. Tara and I each had a this beer that was described as "Like Scotch, but Beer". It was great, but each one cost like 1.50, so we had one apiece. We\'ll probably go back sometime.

properties.name: betty's
properties.description: Posted by Drted240 King St E, TorontoBetty\'s. It\'s where everyone from the Sun goes boozing.I hooked up with Tara there. It\'s a good place.

properties.name: the Beir Markt
properties.description: Posted by Drted58 the esplanade, TorontoThe Beir Markt. They have an amazing array of beer. It\'s a great place, although, kinda more trendy than I usually fit in with, but I still enjoy going. Loads of different beers are there to be drank.

properties.name: the Fox and Firkin
properties.description: Posted by Drted51 Eglinton Ave. East TorontoWhen I was moving to Toronto, I was staying in a hotel at Mt. Pleasant and Eglington. I went here a few times. They have NTN trivia like I expect a Firkin place should.

properties.name: the Highlander Pub
properties.description: Posted by Drted115 Rideau Street, ottawa ONI visited this bar in July 2006. I heard it had Caledonian 80 shilling - my favourite beer. Turns out it was a great little place, and had my beer :) Fast forward about 4 weeks, I\'m back in Ottawa and I stop in there again. The same bartender from the previous month, Dave, goes "hmmm... the ol\' rolodex is kinda fuzzy on the name, but I think you want an 80 shilling!" Yeah, tip Dave well. He\'s a great bartender.

properties.name: the Swan and Firkin
properties.description: Posted by Drted2205 Bloor Street West TorontoThe Swan and Firkin. Meh, it\'s okay. It doesn\'t have NTN trivia like nearly every Firkin pub does. Fuckers. >:(
